website_summaries.verdict: The Wireless Sensor Bar is invaluable for large, complicated Wii-equipped home theater setups, but you don't really need it if your Wii is right next to your television.
pros: Wireless sensor bar for the Wii
sturdier than the wired version included with the console
cons: power saver mode is more annoying than convenient
requires an endless supply of four AA batteries

customer_reviews.title: Worked well with emulator on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: This worked well with my Wii emulator on Windows 10. It was plug and play and the wands were detected right away. I did have to move the sensor to a more central location as the tracking distance is not very far, I would guess 10-15 ft at most. 5/5 - I hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Battery life leaves a bit to be desired
customer_reviews.text: [...] Rorke Haining's review linked above beat me to the punch. In short, it's a great concept but rather than battery powered it would be better to have an option for a power adapter - either to a USB port, to a plug-in charger, or even to the Wii connector. Battery life is limited to a few days and there is no sleep mode, the only option for power management is a 1 or 2 hour timer that lets loose with screeching before shutting down. Wireless is great if you can set it and forget it for a few months, but I'll probably either modify it such that I can power it externally or buy a.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bower

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product with great features
customer_reviews.text: Better than the one that comes with the unit. I love the timer feature because it makes it easy to set limits for the kids. Once the timer goes off , your done for the day, oh and it saves the battery
customer_reviews.author: Blackjack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed. I received the cordless sensor bar today in the mail and upon opening the package I noticed that it had previously been opened before. Both ends of the package containing the wii have been cut with a razor blade of some kind and no attempt was even made to put it back together. Nowhere is there any indication that this sensor bar was anything but brand-new. I feel this is a bit misleading.. I am having my TV and peripherals installed this weekend the Wii included. I'll add more once we see whether or not the Wii With the sensor bar works.
customer_reviews.author: ParrotHeadWNY

customer_reviews.title: A better alternative to the wired version
customer_reviews.text: When I used the wired sensor bar that came with the Wii, I had a recurring concern that I might break the wire because of how thin it is. With the wireless version, not only has it been effortless to use, it has a much better range for pointing at the screen. I find that I forget to turn off the device because I covered the blue light with black electric tape, but the 1hr-2hr alarm fixes this problem. Turning off the alarm causes the batteries to empty after gameplay, so be sure to remember to turn it off after playing. Overall I'm very satisfied with this product and I hope to get products from Nyko with similar quality.
customer_reviews.author: Crillz

customer_reviews.title: Four stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after the cat chewed through the original's power cord. Works at least as well as the original, but uses batteries fairly quickly. Not sure why you actually need this to be cordless. I had to use rolled-over pieces of duct tape to keep it attached to the entertainment centre as the provided adhesive is not very sticky. Overall does the job, but adds to the many AA batteries you will go through using a Nintendo Wii.
customer_reviews.author: KRM

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement Wii sensor bar
customer_reviews.text: In the process of moving our TV & Wii from one room to the other, our original Wii sensor bar was damaged. After reading over reviews here on Amazon, I decided to go with thebased on not only the reviews, but also the cost. It was easy to connect and we had our Wii back up and running very quickly. I used my own batteries to power it and since we purchased this in December, they haven't needed to be replaced. Overall the sensor bars response seems just as good as the original and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Great extended range
customer_reviews.text: With a 65" TV, I had to move the recliner up closer to the set before the sensor included with the Wii would pick up the Wiimote's movements. This little unit put an end to that. It drastically improved the range, and I no longer have to rearange the furniture every time I play. The directions are pretty non-descript; it doesn't connect to the Wii directly - just turn it on and set it in front of the TV. The directions didn't really say anything on how to use it, other than how to use the timer. Battery life seems okay. We just bought a bunch of rechargeables, and it's not an issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulett

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine is defective?
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this because it was on sale on Amazon for $13.99. I'd stick with the original sensor bar because for some reason, I get a choppy cursor. When I move my Wiimote around, the cursor doesn't move around the screen very smoothly. I don't know why. I'm not giving this a bad review nor can I give it a good review since I might have received a defective one. I don't really know for sure. I'll just pack it up and use it for when I travel. I don't have pets or kids to destroy my wire like many other reviewers said; so I'm content with the original sensor bar.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have a cat that likes to chew cords!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my friend/housemate cause his cat kept eating through the sensor bar cord! I've heard a lot of people mention their cats going for them, but only the sensorbar cord... is it flavored? lol Anyway, the batterylife is pretty good - we play prolly a few hours a day and can go about 1-2 months without replacing them. I recommend using some kind of sticky tape or adhesive and attach to the top of your tv
customer_reviews.author: Jake Eastern

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: After swapping in the Nyko wireless sensor bar, my Wii cursor becomes choppy and tends to jump all over the screen. It's no help adjusting the remote sensitivity in Wii settings - I couldn't get the two flashing dots at any sensitivity level. I had to swap back the wired Wii sensor bar. Perhaps I've received a defective unit. I've contacted Nyko support by email and has yet to heard back. The two stars I give are for the its good looks and the ease of use. I would have given this a 5 star if only I could get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gary X

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: My cats kept chewing the cord on my other sensor bar so I opted for a wireless one. It works fine but I would suggest getting a rechargeable batteries. the sensor does offer the option of turning off after I or 2 hours but if you switch to the off position and leave it on the batteries will discharge quickly. there is a alarm but that does not go off until you have a low charge condition. the unit works fine otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Brown

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment construction is problematic
customer_reviews.text: When I first ordered this sensor bar it was dead on arrival. Amazon quickly replaced it. The new one worked flawlessly for four months before the battery compartment started to get loose. Eventually, the batteries wouldn't fit in the compartment right and make proper contact. So, the sensor bar won't power. While the bar will function as advertised, the build quality is disappointing. Hopefully, now that it has been about 6 months since my order Amazon will attempt to resolve the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Boik

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Stable Wireless Version of the Original
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing spectacular about this sensor bar, but if you want to place your sensor bar a good distance away from your Wii, this is a great product to help make that happen. It has an alarm that can remind you to turn it off, since it does run on batteries, that you can set to 1 hour, 2 hours, or off. It's sufficiently sensitive and does its job well. My only wish is that it had a function to make it turn off automatically after 2 hours rather than just an alarm. That would be a great convenience.
customer_reviews.author: NBS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this a month ago and it broke less than two weeks later. It fell off of the tv about three feet to a thickly carpeted floor, causing a tiny plastic piece inside the battery area to dislodge, rendering it useless. The battery area design is very poor, as I found out when I did what I should have done, and bought the $20 Wii model from Best Buy. That one is great, and doesn't have to be treated with kid gloves. Don't waste your money here. Just opt for the better option, even if it is a little more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I mostly purchased this to make my space look more aesthetically pleasing. It succeeds in doing just that. It's essentially just a bunch of lights, nothing specially but it has a nice expensive look for it and I got it on sale. I've notice the sensitivity is just the same as original wii bar and the range has actually increased! As other reviewers have stated you can actually gain even better results if you want to use both together and stack it. I rather just get rid of the wires so I didn't but I did try it out. This product is amazing. It's hard to go wrong with something like this and they definitely didn't disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Pryce

customer_reviews.title: Drops range quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This sensor bar does what it says. If the wires are really a hassle, you will be happy with it. Providing you don't have too large a room and play the Wii too often. The range of this one is a good five feet further than the OEM, but then it drops dramatically as the batteries wear down. If you're like most of us, and hate to buy batteries, this is a real pain. I mean, that's why this company sold so many remote chargers. Bottom line: If you put in more that a few hours a week on your Wii, live with the wires and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Herron

customer_reviews.title: Simplify your Wi installation
customer_reviews.text: Our room and Audio- Visual equipment location was made much easier with the wireless bar. Our remotes are also picked up from a greater distance than than with the original wired system. I was able to mount the Wi game in a cabinet under the Receiver with all its accessories and run the whole system (satellite, dvd, Wi and apple and Apple TV) from across the room through one HDMI cable and clear up the install.
customer_reviews.author: trailrunner

customer_reviews.title: working well so far
customer_reviews.text: my tv hangs from the ceiling, so i didn't want any extra wires dangling all about. this product fit the bill. i've only used it a few times, but it seems to work fine. it's a bit heavy with the batteries inside, so make sure whatever tape/adhesive you use to mount it to the tv is nice and strong. can't comment on power consumption (battery life) yet, since i'm still on the first set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Battery Powered
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sensor bar thinking that it would help. The problem is that to leave it on permanently drains the battery in about two days. Also, it has this timer thing on it that beeps but does not turn it off--it just keeps beeping until you turn the thing off. Other than that it is a great product. Much better than the one that comes with the Wii. I just wish it didn't chew through batteries so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Noren

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the Nyko Wireless Sensor Bar for my new wall mounted HDTV. It works well, and it comes with a set of batteries, though I've got quite a few AA rechargeables already for my remotes. You don't have to use the timer if you don't want to, and in my situation, it isn't that big of a deal to manually turn the sensor on and off. The packaging was pretty interesting, coming in a hard plastic tube which I guess you can store your old wired bar or this one. If you're in the market for a replacement sensor bar and don't want to bother with making one yourself, this one is a quality third party accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Maloran

customer_reviews.title: very good replacement
customer_reviews.text: ok, its amazing really amazing. i bought it about a month ago and have been playing about 5 hours a week. the only problem with it is that it turns on spontaneously: i would play my game, turn off the sensor bar, and some time later, it would turn on itself. i dont know if i have a defective bar, but i just take care of the problem by taking out one of the AA batteries from the sensor bar. overall its a great wireless sensor bar, and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bikran Sandhu

customer_reviews.title: Kills batteries
customer_reviews.text: Terrible in so far as it drains batteries, seemingly even while the bar is in the 'off' position. Worse still, it will discharge rechargeables to the point where some NiMH batteries fail to charge ever again, rendering the product yet more expensive than third party wired replacements. Trust me, find something else.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Kittens chewed my stock sensor, so this was my replacement. I'd have liked on with a non-battery option, but the wireless is nice. The timer feature is nice because I often leave it on. There is a very bright led to remind you, but I found it annoying. I solved that with a red sticker, I can still see the light, but it's more of a glow now.
customer_reviews.author: The Yeknod

customer_reviews.title: It's not a game, Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This product is being rated by Amazon as a game, not an accessory. That makes it kind of a skewed review with my star choosing. However, this is a great option for us! We take our Wii with us to friends houses and having a 2nd sensor bar such as this one makes it easy to go. Less wires to untangle and pack; just grab the Wii and go basically now.
customer_reviews.author: Brett & Jenni Goodlin

customer_reviews.title: great aftermarket product for the WII
customer_reviews.text: The original sensor bar cable is very fragile and lost a battle to the vacumn cleaner. This replacement is great, and ours no longer beeps as some of complained. Its easy to turn off and on and allows you to put the sensor bar right where you want it and near the screen/TV, and to put the Wii safely behind you since it reads the Wiimote, and not the sensor bar.
customer_reviews.author: bigoil

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great. however, it's worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Inserting the batteries is sometimes annoying. Recently, the light turns on by itself when moved. Seems to have calmed down a bit. I bought this mainly because I hate have the wii sensor bar anywhere near my tv stand when I'm not use the wii. Wireless is the way to go. Get some rechargeable batteries for it.
customer_reviews.author: Marky-sama

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Only works when upside down. It did work normally for the first 10-15 minutes then all haywire. I think it has a loose wire inside or something idk. Oh well. Win some lose son I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because my rabbits chewed through the wire of the original sensor that came with the game. I love this sensor because it is cordless and you can put it anywhere near the T.V. I works just a good as the original. If you are looking for a replacement or a second for another T.V. you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalSona

customer_reviews.title: Wii wireless sensor bar
customer_reviews.text: I like that the wii sensor bar is wireless and that although it's slightly larger than the sensor bar that came with the wii, it still fits into the same holder. I also like that the bar reminds you by a loudish beeping should you forget to turn it off. The only thing I would change would be that the bar coincidingly turn off with the wii.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Purchase at your own peril ...
customer_reviews.text: This item worked fine for about two weeks. At least I think it did. I initially only used the wireless sensor bar for EA Sports Active 2, which doesn't require much cursor action. The problems started when I tried to play Metroid Prime Trilogy. The buttons worked, but the cursor was nowhere to be found. Then I tried World of Goo, Bit Trip Beat, and so on, but to no avail. I never thought I would have so much trouble finding a suitable replacement for my original sensor bar. I'll probably go with the refurbished wired one straight from Nintendo. These wireless sensor bars seem to be more trouble than they're worth.
customer_reviews.author: DJ DPAD

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for oem unit
customer_reviews.text: No wires for the cat to chew off, and it works like a charm! Kids are happy with it. You just need to make sure that you turn the thing off after use, or your batteries will die. My kids learned that the hard way... they couldn't figure out why the thing was working. Serves them right! :)
customer_reviews.author: DNFFTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Works Well - Battery Life Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Use with my home theater. Works well. Other Wii users say it bests than their orginal equip. Even using 2400mAh+ rechargable AA batteries, I'm changing them aprox. 1x/week (about 10 hrs. of play). Not terrible. Just hoped the 1hr auto-shut off timer, IR-LEDs (low power) and four batteries would equal longer battery life. It beeps for 2 min to alert players that unit will be shutting down. However, if no-one is playing it can be heard several rooms away. Quick fix. Put clear tape on the speaker hole to muffle the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: You know, how many things in today's high tech world just work? And I mean just work? I'm a computer programmer who's always been into tech and frankly I'm very used to having to spend at least an hour working out the gotcha's. Well with the Nykno wireless sensor bar I did end up spending out the most bizzar gotcha ever. The fact that there were no gotcha's, it seriously just works!!! You just put in the batteries, turn it on and you have senor bar. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Carlo

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR OWNERS OF CATS WHO CHEW WIRES!
customer_reviews.text: I actually ended up having to purchase this because my cats love to chew wires and they ate right through the original wired sensor bar that we received with our wii. This is perfect. The only thing that I wish was different was that the blue light on the bar wasn't so bright-a bit distracting. But overall, a lifesaver for pet owners!
customer_reviews.author: L. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Not far reaching enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so I could use it in my apartment with my projector and the signal simply didn't reach far enough to make it worth it . It didn't even reach as far as the normal wii bar with any sort of accuracy so I couldn't see a practical use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The product itself responded good so I can't complain about that. It's just a pain to have to turn it off to conserve battery power. I found the corded ones to be better for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great even in a large room.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best remote sensor bar. Being able to set an automatic timer to shut itself off after 1 hour or 2 hours is priceless. (The kids are never going to remember to turn it off). Get some rechargeable batteries and you'll love this wireless addition to your Wii or Wii U.
customer_reviews.author: Aljoluju

customer_reviews.title: The Wireless Power
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no wires, no receivers and works for hours on end. I can use it anywhere in my room, even if my Wii is on the opposite end of the room, which is 15 x 15. I played for nearly 6 hours and it never ran out of power, out the two months I've had it, I have yet to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Brantley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing....
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this wireless sensor.... Just amazing... The people who gave bad reviews must of gotten bad ones. Cause mine is very good. It makes no sounds at all and is a major step up from the wire. ANYONE who has a Wii MUST buy this.... Deffinately worth it. (Buy rechargable batteries too)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Olzak

customer_reviews.title: Love and hate it.....
customer_reviews.text: love it and hate it... Why the batteries run out fast but love that i can use it with my wii with out all the cablets
customer_reviews.author: Jose Real

customer_reviews.title: Love this wireless bar
customer_reviews.text: Love this wireless bar. No hanging wires when connected and battery life is good. Connection is awesome! Haven't had a problem with it detecting the remotes.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearx5

customer_reviews.title: Love the wireless sensor bar
customer_reviews.text: This is a good wireless bar for Wii. The only thing I would ask of the manufacturer is to make the blue light indicator a little dimmer. It's on the front of the bar and is very bright and is on whenever the Wii is in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Adams

customer_reviews.title: Freakin' Awesome Works Great (MAY NEED TO ADJUST SENSITIVITY IN WII MENU FOR BEST RESULTS!!!)
customer_reviews.text: At first the wireless bar had same problem mentioned in another review (it wasn't tracking unless I was right next to the bar. I went into wii menu and reset the Sensitivity factory wii setting is 3 I set it to 5 after checking 4. It works great from every angle and distance set at 5 now. So if your having that problem just go into wii menu and fix it very easy to do. Awesome Product
customer_reviews.author: Chuck G

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could sit further from my tv while playing and it works well. It's also ideal if you move your Wii to another location. My wired sensor bar was all intertwined with my other wires and difficult to move. Now when we take our Wii on vacation it's much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Slightly Grumpy in Upstate NY

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We were not impressed with this at all. It didn't work from very far away, if and when it worked at all and it went through batteries like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Trussell

customer_reviews.title: wireless is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I accidently sucked up the wire to the original sensor with the vacuum cleaner one day, ugh. Needless to say, it was destroyed. But I was GREATLY relieved to find that the replacement sensor bar had no wire and was less than $15. It works just like the original.
customer_reviews.author: P. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. My original sensor bar cord was destroyed when my cat thought it was a chew toy. That is definitely no longer an issue now that I have this wireless one. It also allows me to put my Wii in a more reasonable spot because I'm not tethered to a good sensor bar location.
customer_reviews.author: Left Ear of Corn

customer_reviews.title: further from tv?? hardly lol a lot less
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing under the impression that it would let us sit further away. Well after installing and turning this thing on, it's exactly the opposite. We can't even sit on our couch in our tiny apartment which worked great before... The wii remote cursor starts flicking around 5-6 feet from the tv. It's unusable and I feel cheated. Stay away from this product. I'm going to buy a replacement wired one from nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Holland

customer_reviews.title: Wireless = Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The wireless sensor bar make life so much easier. I used to duck tape the wired-sensor on my OLD TV (because i cant afford a flat screen tv). But now with the wireless its so much better! I also like the automatic-switch-off button in case i forget to turn this off, it will automatically turn off for me after an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Kiely K. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because my Wii is located in a closet in the back of my theater room and I needed the sensor bar to be in the front under the screen. Well, this took care of that problem. It works perfectly. I love it and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Evonne Williams

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product  minus
customer_reviews.text: the battery gobbling ability. I feel that this bar has definitely improved our playing ability of the wii with a mounted LCD but the fact that it eats up batteries means you need rechargable batteries on hand to make sure you dont destroy your gaming experience
customer_reviews.author: F. Arshad

customer_reviews.title: Making Wii Sense
customer_reviews.text: With the idea of Wii being active; we often had issues with being close enough to the sensor bar and yet far enough away to avoid each other and the screen. This wii bar made it all a go and now we are wii-ing it up. Batteries last for weeks even though we put in a good 1-2hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Hanza

customer_reviews.title: been very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for previously owned one in which the batteries leaked, no fault of the bar .... been very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ball

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. I really wanted to put my Wii far from the TV, thus neccessitating a wireless sensor bar. The quality of the sensor bar is nowhere near as good as the original Wii one, frequently losing signal. It's not awful or unplayable or anything, but it's just clearly and significantly not as good as the original. It also eats batteries for breakfast. I'd estimate the batteries last no more than 20 hours, because if I ever forget and leave it on overnight, the batteries are dead when I wake up. That means the battery drains almost faster than the wiimotes, which drain fast themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: One of best purchases I've made
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased this item is that my cat chewed through the wired sensor bar. so I knew that buying another wired model would br a waste of time and money. This wireless model works flawlessly and workable distance is as far or further than the wired model. The only drawback is that it requires batteries which have to be replaced periodically but less so than I wouls have had to keep replacing the wired model. Does anyone want a male neutered ginger cat?
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Emmel

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: We have cats, and they always chewed our Wii wires! NO MORE! We have had this sensor bar for over a year and it works faithfully! Buy rechargeable batteries!!! BUY with confidence! We were very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Well this one isn't a game...
customer_reviews.text: But it helps with playing the games. Only caveat, make sure that you set the timer when you get it, as it defaults to no timer and then chews up the battery as a result. The alarm that sounds when the timer has expired is a bit loud, I wish it had volume control. Other than that, it's more sensitive than the bar shipped with the Wii and eliminates the need for the wire that plugs it into the Wii (which only provides power for the LEDs).
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Wii Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Great price. This Wii Wireless Sensor Bar works great in our living room and when we're on the go. It works great when we hook the Wii up to our projector because we attach the sensor to the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Moneysaver

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a add-on/ replacement of the old sensor bar. I have used both of them at the same time and did notices better stability and the pointer didn't shake as much. its great when playing with 4 people it feels more accurate. love the timer which comes in handy. we use the 1hr setting when we have a party so everyone gets to play at lest 1hr
customer_reviews.author: wilronald ayala

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptops
customer_reviews.text: Great for laptops that can emulate wii games and connect with wii remotes. Fits easily enough on TV's or in a laptop bag.
customer_reviews.author: Njrg

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than i expected.
customer_reviews.text: This bar actually works VERY good and even at close range. I bought it for a buddy's daughter and she gives it a SERIOUS workout constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: not a game but a GREAT accessory
customer_reviews.text: Not yet sure about battery life, but this saved me a lot of re-wiring (as the projection on my wall is on the other side of the wii). No brainer set up and timer is good idea on this unit. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MPT

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It has a good range (it's more than 10 feet from the Wii-which is in a cabinet) and works fine. Setup was zero effort. It has a timer that you can set to have it turn off by itself if you forget.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless sensor bar works great. when the distance from your tv is to far from your console, this is the way to go. It shuts down fairly quickly when no remotes are in use. Would recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wireless sensor bar for Wii
customer_reviews.text: Loved this thing right out of the box. Worked great right up until some "new" batteries leaked all over the place. I am bummed, but I will definitely be buying another one of these things.
customer_reviews.author: darvon6900

customer_reviews.title: Great product !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing... We have a 50" plazma mounted on the wall and all the cables run inside the wall, so there are no cables in sight. So now, even the Sensor bar is wire free !! very clean and neat. I think the reange is much better as well. The motion on the screen seems smoother to me....
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 a very good bar if you want wireless buy it...
customer_reviews.author: T00nZ

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: The signal is strong, no worries with cables. You can set a timer in 1 to 2 h increments. Really handy when timing my Son's time at the Wii
customer_reviews.author: CaribeLady

customer_reviews.title: wireless sensor bar for wii
customer_reviews.text: my original sensor bar that came with my wii was broken/ nonuseable , i needed this wireless one in a hurry and revieved it promptly and it works perfectly thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW: Nyko Wireless Sensor Bar for Wii
customer_reviews.text: Works OK Eats batteries voraciously. No auto shutdown. Shipped fast. Price was decent.
customer_reviews.author: DEEPNHOCK

customer_reviews.title: great find
customer_reviews.text: My cat thought it in her best wisdom to destroy our original wii sensor so this wireless solution seemed like a better option. Turns out it works just as well if not better than the original. Very happy and great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Petro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup & Use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as the setup in my room had the original bar running across the room, making it easy for someone to trip over the wire. The wireless bar, is super easy to use and setup. Just added the batteries, turned it on and unplugged the wired bar and it all worked great. Highly recommend it. It's nice to not have to worry about the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A Must have for the Wii!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a problem with this item, works great above or below my 1080p HDTV, would recommend it if you love your Wii and one less wired item in the mix.
customer_reviews.author: skf1965

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Wii Sensor
customer_reviews.text: We have a home theater setup and the Wii console is located next to the projector. It was inconvenient to have to position the console so that the wired sensor was next to the screen. The wireless sensor is well designed with an alarm and automatic turn-off. It is easy to forget it.
customer_reviews.author: HE Larson

customer_reviews.title: Wireless sensor Bar for Wii
customer_reviews.text: Great device! I only wish my Pet had chewed the wire on my original wired bar sooner; not really due to pet safety but you get my drift! This Bar works better and farther then old on and " No more safety hazards for our pets". Very afforable too.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Salo

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Sensor Bar Wii
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product, still use it now. Works good with the wiimote and wii. Pros: Last a long time, light to show battery life, durable, Can turn off if playing a game that doesnt use it. Cons: needs 4 AA batteries, runs out of batteries in a couple days.(but still tolerable)
customer_reviews.author: regalado7

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat price. Works okay
customer_reviews.text: We purchased it to use with projector in rec room. The ON light is very distracting (ended up putting tap over it). Plus we have to position ourselves to get it to work properly. Other than that, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kullberg

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My boys accidentally broke the wired connection so we bought this. It works just as good as the wired connection but is more portable.
customer_reviews.author: charles vanbelle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...
customer_reviews.text: The blue LED on this bar does not work, right out of the package. It still emits IR and functions, but without the LED, it is easy to forget it is on. The only saving grace is the alarm feature, which you can set to one or two hours. The alarm is the only way to tell if you left it on accidentally. If I were to do it again, I'd just go back to the wired version (and probably will when this dies).
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Larger than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I travel with my wii alot. I was nervous I would damage the spaghetti cord on the orginal sensor bar and bought this as a back up. The sensor bar is much larger than I anticipated. It's about 12 inches long and 1 or 1.5 inches tall, so it's longer than the wii console itself. Needless to say it doesn't fit in the wii tote bag. Works great, however. Runs on 4 AA batteries, which are included. I payed $9, so for that price, there's nothing I can complain about.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eberhardt

customer_reviews.title: No more cords
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Wii, like me you probably end up dragging it around and hooking it up to all the places you go. With the wireless bar its just one less cord to hook/unhook and wind up. Performance wise I think the bar has a longer range but not as much width and is not as responsive. Over all it evens out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Used too much batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Wireless Sensor worked good, but sure did use a lot of batteries! Would not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Nelson III

customer_reviews.title: Better Sensor
customer_reviews.text: This bar performs better than the original that came with the Wii. I needed to put a piece of masking tape over the blue status LED because it was too bright.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Its Good and Bad....
customer_reviews.text: You see, the sensor bar has its pros and cons Pros Makes the whole sensor bar experience easier without the wire connecting it. (My cats always chewed on it) Easy to turn on, just push a button Cons Very limited battery life, an hour of playing will denote the need for four more batteries which..... Are very hard to put in the bar thing. More than ten feet away makes the wii glove dance and skip around almost all the time, except for when the batteries are fresh, which is only for five minutes or so.
customer_reviews.author: Apu

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drain, Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The wireless sensor bar works really well with a new set of batteries, but it drains them in a matter of days and as it drains the signal gets weaker and weaker, so you have to sit closer and closer to it, and your wiimote cursor will go in and out. So unless you NEED a wireless sensor bar, stick with the wired ones, they're more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Serial Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to go on top of the corded one it works great, just use rechargeable batteries it will stay charged a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Haines

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: this sensor is better than the one that comes with the wii, no jumping cursor or other crap, also there is no receiver attached to the wii. the only bad thing is the blue LED telling you that its turned on
customer_reviews.author: A Person

customer_reviews.text: it works just great, really handy, you see i have 5 cats and they always pull the old sensor trough the wire and trow it at the ground obviously it wouldn't last long so before they could break the original one, i bought this one and i loved it
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great range!
customer_reviews.text: Works great 25'+ away! The led light is annoying and very bright, but is only on when the wireless bar is on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy N. Shank

customer_reviews.title: Wii Sensor Bar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wireless bar for my Wii. Works great. The bright blue light is a little distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Just Works.
customer_reviews.text: Greetings from Costa Rica The product it's as described, mint, working, that's all. and of course, it's cheap xDD
customer_reviews.author: Kristian

customer_reviews.title: Wii Sensor Bar
customer_reviews.text: Definately a good investment if you take your Wii outside the home. I would recommend carrying extra batteries, which you should do anyways for the controllers. Great product for the price. Sensor bar had no problems allowing controller to pick up sensor bar until the batteries got low. A must for traveling wiis.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Henry

customer_reviews.title: better range than the stock !
customer_reviews.text: this has better range than the stock one! if you have range problems then get it if not stay with the original!
customer_reviews.author: G. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. I have not had any negative battery life issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Big Screens
customer_reviews.text: I have a 73" TV and the regular wired sensor bar just didn't work very well. I put this sensor bar under the wired one, and I noticed a major difference. I can now sit down on my couch which is about 15ft away from my TV and use my Wii remote with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: exellent product
customer_reviews.text: this is a very nice option for those who don't like to have a lot of cables allaround and has exellente reception, it could be say that beter than the original the only desadvantaje is that you'll need to change bateries every since and when, they last like 30 hours, playing hard.
customer_reviews.author: THE GILZ

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic!
customer_reviews.text: Just put batteries and it automatically works? I have no clue how it works but it does. No need to sync or anything. The timer function comes in handy if u are somebody that loses track of time. Worth the 5$
customer_reviews.author: dudeofdur

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: It worked great the first week. Then it got weak. We had to jump around and move and really struggle to get the sensor to sense our controllers. We kept replacing the batteries (we made sure to turn it off after every play) and it would work good for a day or two and then it would not sense again. Now, after a month of use, even when the batteries are replaced and we do flips in front of the TV, it will not sense a thing and I am on-line buying another sensor bar. My recommendation is to not buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: S. DEWITT

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: The transaction was perfect and the delivery right on time as promised. I would do business with this seller again. Five stars! I out-boxed the wireless sensor bar, put the batteries in and turned it on. The Wii worked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nyko Wireless Sensor Bar for Wii
product_meta.description: Simplify and enhance your Wii® set up with Nyko’s Wireless Sensor Bar for Wii. The Wireless Sensor Bar allows full Wii Remote functionality without the hassle or mess of any wired connection to the console. The infrared field created by the Wireless Sensor Bar allows for play up to 25 feet away, perfect for larger or wall-mounted TVs. Compatible with Nintendo's official Sensor Bar stand, the Wireless Sensor Bar is easy to set up, requiring no software or hardware installation on the Wii. Featuring 30 hours of battery life off 4 AA batteries (included) and a unique power saver mode with audible alarm, the Wireless Sensor Bar is designed for ultimate convenience.
feature_bullets: Allows for clean, easy, wire-free installation
Compatible with the Nintendo Wii sensor bar stand
Sleek design blends in with TV and is compatible with standard sensor bar stand
Audible alarm warns when powered for too long and will even automatically shut off the device
The IR field created by the Wireless Sensor Bar allows for play up to 25 feet away
4 AA batteries (included) provide up 30 hours of use; No cords needed
